messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] books on tape/was getting to bed
messages.msgSnippet: ... My brother had saved the old Bill Cosby albums and when Dylan was five or so he sent us copies.  The Chicken Heart,  Noah, and some others. They re so
messages.messageBody:
> Any other favorite artist?

My brother had saved the old Bill Cosby albums and when Dylan was five or
so he sent us copies. The Chicken Heart, Noah, and some others.
They're so hilarious, but we haven't listened in awhile. Time to find
them again I guess.

Dylan liked the Growler Tapes when he was younger, but I don't think they
interest him now.

Deb L

messages.subject: books on tape/was getting to bed
messages.msgSnippet: We are avid Jim Weiss fans here...Boomerang is also well loved.  Then there is Odds Bodkin and Jackie Torrence... Any other favortite artist? ... From: Deborah
messages.messageBody:
We are avid Jim Weiss fans here...Boomerang is also well loved. Then there is Odds Bodkin and Jackie Torrence...

Any other favortite artist?
----- Original Message -----
From: Deborah Lewis
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 02, 2002 7:36 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Getting to bed (was Tools of convincing)



***I need them to go before I
am too sleepy to give it too them. If they are still awake at nine
o'clock
I am past being able to do much for them so they don't get a story as I
am
likely to have already climbed in my bed. But I find that if they get in
bed by eight I can easily read to them for 40 minutes or so...***

Stories on tape! Dylan loved the Jim Weiss tapes and still listens
sometimes. Or nice music. Makes me sleepy just thinking about it.

Who said they would read in their sleep? Sandra? I've done that. Proof
my mouth can keep going even when my brain has abandon ship.

Deb L
